neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Kendall Square One Bedroom, One Block from Kendall
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 24 years of experience in the industry. This sleek residence captures the energy of the city with modern architecture, the richness of a vibrant neighborhood, and luxury amenities. Indulge in an array of amenities such as concierge service, a game room, a conference room, a 24-hour fitness center with yoga room and children’s play area, a heated indoor swimming pool, a media room, a private courtyard with grilling areas, on-site Zipcar vehicles and more. The surrounding Kendall Square area is an eclectic, robust, tech-centered neighborhood near the Charles River, Harvard University and MIT. Easily travel the rest of the city and metro area by walking to one of four T stations serving the Green, Red, Orange and Blue lines, in addition to two bus stations and the Boston North Amtrak Station.

The space
Design
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about:
I work for Furnished Quarters, the largest provider of furnished apartments in the Northeast. My family started this business over 20 years ago and we welcome the opportunity to host you in our apartments. 

Guests can expect a comfortable, fully furnished and equipped private apartment, plenty of helpful neighborhood information and 24-hour access to our team. We consider ourselves first and foremost a hospitality company and we are here to provide a worry-free stay that enables you to enjoy the city and feel like a local from the moment you arrive.

Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. name: Modern 3 Bedroom Single Family in Mid-Cambridge
description:
***MINIMUM TWO MONTHS RENTAL***

The best Cambridge offers is literally less than a mile away from any direction from this amazing recently renovated single family home. This is our home that we rent 3-5 months a year during our travels. We are looking for a family to call it home and care for it as their own during their stay. This spacious and modern attached single-family is located in the heart of historic Mid Cambridge.

The space
It has three large bedrooms (1 used as a family room/office - with twin bed and large mirrored sliding closets), a home gym, two roof top balconies and a sunny patio with a side yard.

Other things to note
Amazing location. You are a mile away from Harvard Sq and University, Central Sq, Inman Sq, and Charles River. Multiple food markets, Cambridge Library, and tennis courts are a short walk away.

Harvard T Station - 10 minute walk
Central T Station - 15 minute walk
Bus 68 Stop
neighborhood_overview: Amazing location located in a very safe neighborhood in Mid-Cambridge.  Near Cambridge Library and Park.  You are a mile away from Hardvard Sq and University, Central Sq, Inman Sq, and Charles River.   Multiple food markets, Cambridge Library, and tennis courts are within short walking distance.
host_about: My wife and I live in Cambridge MA.  We have two daughters, one is a nurse and the other is studying to become an OT and lives in Boston.  We have recently retired and planning to travel 3-5 months a year and rent our home while we are not in Cambridge.

name: (12) Perfect WFH set up in Harvard/MIT
description:
Enjoy this Victorian era house built in 1867 with modern amenities. This is a simply decorated WFH-style room with private bathroom consist of one queen size bed, a study desk, and a mini fridge. Comes with linen and shower towel/person, shared common areas include living room, dining room, and kitchen; high speed WiFi.

The space
Due to COVID-19 safety protocols, we are asking our guests to limit their uses of shared areas including the living room, dining room, and kitchen areas to one party at a time.

Other things to note
PARKING: Please note that we have very limited parking spaces. If you will have a car during your stay, please contact me prior to booking to confirm parking availability. We will try out best to reserve a guest street parking permit which will allow our guests to park on the street to up to three days per week, excluding permit-free Sunday.

Laundry: As an added convenience to our guests, we offer on-site wash
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

host_about: Hi, we're an older couple nearing retirement. We've been married for over 50 years and we like to meeting new people! You are welcome to stay with us and our Chihuahua mix in our rustic Village Tudor, or in any of our other properties. We frequently take long walks along the Charles.  Regardless, I welcome you to experience the Greater Boston area, it truly is an incredible neighborhood, a perfect blend of historic and modern ambiance.

name: Dramatic 2BR Penthouse by MIT/Harvard w/ Parking!
description:
Modern, clean, renovated 2 bedroom condo/flat in prime Central Square by Harvard & MIT (1 parking space, in-unit laundry, central heat & AC included). Located on quiet, leafy 1-way street only 7 minute walk from Redline Central Square metro station, 3 minutes from Whole Foods. Smoke-free, pet-free, shoe-free home.

The space
Our condo was fully renovated recently with high-end, modern finishes. Amenities include free high-speed wireless internet, 1 free parking space, free in-unit laundry, central AC and central heat. Both bedrooms have a queen-sized memory foam bed.

The kitchen is fully applianced with Bosch stainless steel appliances, coffee maker, an electric water kettle, microwave, and small dining table that can easily seat 3-4. There is a desk/table in the open plan living space, suitable for both dining and working. The bathroom has a tub/shower and is decorated with Italian porcelain tiles. The apartment has new red oak hardwood floors througho
neighborhood_overview:
Centrally located between Harvard and MIT. 7 minute walk to Central Square subway station. 15 minute walk to MIT. 25 minute walk to Harvard. Surrounded by multiple grocery stores, local restaurants, co-working spaces, cafes, bars, and modern conveniences.

There is a small locally-owned convenience store a few steps from the front door for any last minute necessities.

The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place. 3 mins walk to the subway central station. 1 bedroom in a brand new apartment. Laundry in the room. Close to MIT and Harvard. Hmart is three minutes away too. There is gym and outside garden in the building.

The space
The entire private bedroom with big walk-in closet. The dining room, kitchen and bathroom are shared with one more person.

name: (023) Bright and cozy single room with two beds
description:
Blending modern conveniences with historic charm in this 1867 Victorian-style house, this guest room has one full size bed and a single bed. In addition, the room can be booked together with next room (Room 22) for a family or large group trip up to 4 people. If booked together, the combined ensuite is consisted of two bedrooms, with the private bathroom located in the larger guest room. Located just 7 minutes from the Red Line T, we are at the heart of Cambridge between Harvard and MIT.

The space
Due to COVID-19 safety protocols, we are asking our guests to limit their uses of shared areas including the living room, dining room, and kitchen areas to one party at a time.

Guest access
Stairs: Please note that this guest room is located on the second floor of the 3-story house. You will need to climb stairs to access the room.

Other things to note
PARKING: Please note that we have very limited parking spaces. If you wil
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Cambridge 2BR w/ W/D, Private access to Linr Park
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this beautiful Alewife furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and pretty living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS469)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this two-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom include an on-site:

- Dryer
- Elevator
- Gym
- W
neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description:
Welcome to Courtyard Boston Cambridge Hotel!

ENRICH YOUR NEW ENGLAND EXPERIENCE AT OUR CAMBRIDGE HOTEL

Alongside the Charles River, Courtyard Boston Cambridge is surrounded by New England charm and located near local destinations such as the Public Garden, Central Square, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Museum of Science, Kenmore Square and Fenway Park. Dazzle your days touring the historic campuses of Boston University, MIT and Harvard University, or spend an afternoon filling your shopping ba

The space
Find entertainment on our 40-inch flat-screen HDTVs while bundled in our crisp linens and custom comforters, or make productivity a priority at our large ergonomic workstations. After a restful slumber, squeeze in a workout at our 24-hour fitness center stocked with cardio equipment and free weights. Whether you're in Massachusetts for work or pleasure, discover modern comforts for today's traveler at Courtyard Boston Cambridge.

name: One Bedroom in Heart of Kendall Square, Cambridge
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 24 years of experience in the industry. This sleek residence captures the energy of the city with modern architecture, the richness of a vibrant neighborhood, and luxury amenities. Indulge in an array of amenities such as concierge service, a game room, a conference room, a 24-hour fitness center with yoga room and children’s play area, a heated indoor swimming pool, a media room, a private courtyard with grilling areas, on-site Zipcar vehicles and more. The surrounding Kendall Square area is an eclectic, robust, tech-centered neighborhood near the Charles River, Harvard University and MIT. Easily travel the rest of the city and metro area by walking to one of four T stations serving the Green, Red, Orange and Blue lines, in addition to two bus stations and the Boston North Amtrak Station.

The space
Design
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about:
I work for Furnished Quarters, the largest provider of furnished apartments in the Northeast. My family started this business over 20 years ago and we welcome the opportunity to host you in our apartments. 

Guests can expect a comfortable, fully furnished and equipped private apartment, plenty of helpful neighborhood information and 24-hour access to our team. We consider ourselves first and foremost a hospitality company and we are here to provide a worry-free stay that enables you to enjoy the city and feel like a local from the moment you arrive.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

This sun-filled private bath guest room is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has two large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely garden on the side. The room has one full bed, and a full-size sofa bed to fit up to three people. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.

The space
Stairs: Please note that this guest room is located on the second floor of the 3-story house. You will need to climb stairs to access the room.

neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: (30) Top floor family room with private bath rm
description:
Welcome to the Ginkgo House, a Victorian era house built in 1867 with modern amenities. This is a simply decorated family-style room located on the third floor of the house with private bathroom consist of one queen size bed, two singe beds, a study desk, and a mini fridge. Plenty of lights with three windows and a skylight. Shared common areas include living room, dining room, and kitchen; high speed WiFi.

The space
Due to COVID-19 safety protocols, we are asking our guests to limit their uses of shared areas including the living room, dining room, and kitchen areas to one party at a time.

Other things to note
PARKING: Please note that we have very limited parking spaces. If you will have a car during your stay, please contact me prior to booking to confirm parking availability. We will try out best to reserve a guest street parking permit which will allow our guests to park on the street to up to three days per week, excluding permit-fre
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.

name: NEWLY RENOVATED APT IN THE HEART OF CAMBRIDGE!
description:
Kick back and relax in this lovely 2Bedroom Apartment where public transportation is easily accessible and convenient walking distance to Harvard Square and Central Square, which are local historical landmarks and where one will find plenty of stores, restaurants, pharmacies, movie theaters, etc.

You will be minutes from many colleges & universities like Harvard University, Lesley University College of Art & Science, Massachusetts Institute of Technology and many others.

The space
Perfectly quaint and quiet top floor two bedroom unit. The bedrooms are on opposite sides of each other that maintains a certain level of privacy for guest.

The spacious master bedroom has a queen size memory form mattress, mirrored dresser & night stand coupled with a large walk in closet. The closet can double as a combination work room space with a desk, stools and a matching bookcase. Also, there’s a futon sofa couch to relax on prior to laying it down for t
neighborhood_overview:
Apartment is located in a community referred to as Cambridgeport, the beautiful Charles River sits behind the building and on weekends Memorial Drive is closed off for street festivals, bikers, boating events, etc.

Since so close to many historical landmarks there’s always adventure to be taken. Being in Cambridge your in an amazing position to access many parks & recreational activities, museums, art galleries, The Freedom Trail, science centers, the Aquarium and much more.
host_about:
Friendly warm hearted home...

Better Together is our motto and do unto others as you would like done unto you!!!

name: W Cambridge 3BR on bike path: Quiet, cute, balcony
description:
Beautiful 3BR/1BA on 2nd floor with office in quiet W Cambridge. Two balconies, shared backyard on bike path connecting to Minuteman and Charles ... pet-friendly!

Apartment is on a residential street 1/2 block from Fresh Pond, a tranquil 2.5 mile loop and gardens around Cambridge drinking water reservoir.

Your rental is the entire second floor of a two-family. We, the owners, live downstairs.

We own this unit to share with family when they are in town and we rent on Airbnb when it is empty.

The space
Note this is a real home! There is some chipped paint. There are some scuff marks. A real family lives here! Please do not book if you're looking for a pixel-perfect hip modern soulless Ikea catalog page.

Bedroom 1: One queen with limited dresser space. (Note overhead fan and lights are permanently broken, but there are lamps.)
Bedroom 2: One queen with limited dresser space.
Bedroom 3: One twin and small desk.
neighborhood_overview:
West Cambridge is all the convenience of Cambridge with... an actual backyard!

Our street is very quiet, mostly families, and minutes from Fresh Pond, a lovely 2.5 mile loop around a reservoir which is off-leash dog friendly.

Minutes from Belmont, Watertown, Cambridge, and Somerville hot spots.

name: NEW Remodeled 2 Bedroom-Cambridge/Harvard/MIT
description:
Located just outside of Harvard Square and only steps away from scenic walking/jogging/biking paths along the Charles River. This newly renovated, light-filled, spacious(1200 Sq Ft) two bedroom with one and a half bath has been tastefully redesigned.

Whether you are studying or visiting one of the over 70 local universities, on a work trip, or just taking a little vacation you will thoroughly enjoy your stay.

The space
The hosts are designers and have taken the time to make the meticulously remodel and fully furnish the unit to flow both aesthetically and functionally while maintaining its original 1930’s charm. The unit has great natural light and a lot of windows. It has been furnished with all the modern amenities from its mid-century modern furniture to the heated floors in the full bathroom. The kitchen has also just been redone with new stainless appliances and a lot of counter space if you like to cook. The living room has a cozy leather couch,
neighborhood_overview: Just around the corner from Harvard University, Mt Auburn Hospital, restaurants, bars, and coffee shops, with great access to public transportation; This cozy basement apartment is fully furnished with comfortable, modern accents. The Unit is located on Mt Auburn Street Between Longfellow & Channing. This is in a safe, friendly, clean, and vibrant neighborhood. Minutes walk from the Charles River, Harvard Sq., Redline, Harvard University, Mt Auburn Hospital, and Huron Village.
host_about:
We are both designers and love what we do :-) Jordan owns a Design Firm in Boston and Larissa is a landscape architect.  We have both spent a lot of time traveling and met while working in San Francisco (one of our favorite places). We have have two young daughters and split or time between our time between Cambridge, MA and Ogunquit, ME when we are not traveling. Larissa is European so we frequently Travel to Europe to see friends and family in Germany, Turkey, Italy and France. Jordan's work also often brings him to Asia and the west coast.

We enjoy the outdoors as much as possible both beach and mountains. We are also pretty active we enjoy everything from Yoga to Biking to Surfing.  We are also into food and enjoy cooking and BBQing whenever we have time. 

We have been using AirBNB for over 3 yrs now. We have a good amount of experience hosting and really do enjoy meeting so many interesting people. As a host we are pretty hands off but there is we are needed. As long as our rules are observed it will be easy sailing for all. Looking forward having you as a guest.

name: Sunny 1-bedroom apartment near Davis Square
description:
Peaceful apartment with great natural lighting in a safe, walkable neighborhood and central location VERY close to the Davis Sq. T stop on the Red Line (8 mins on foot or 4 mins by BlueBike).

From Davis Station you can be at Harvard Square in 6 mins, MIT in 13 mins, and the Downtown Boston in 20 mins.

The space
Apartment on the third floor of a charming Cambridge building. Includes the following amenities:

- Central heating controlled in-unit + a powerful portable heater
- A/C unit in living room
- Two TVs (living room and bedroom)
- Xfinity box with access to Netflix, Hulu, etc.
- High speed Wi-Fi
- 2 separate desks/work spaces
- COMPLETE kitchenware, with access to all utensils and cooking equipment (fridge & freezer, oven, electric stove, coffee maker, toaster, air fryer, microwave, toaster oven, rice cooker, slow cooker, baking sheets, etc.)
- Hardwood floors in living room & bedroom
- Access to th
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge and Somerville neighborhoods near this apartment are very safe. No issues walking around here, even late at night. Dropped items are often returned to the owners.

2-minute walk to a liquor store. 8-minute walk to Davis Square - featuring lots of bars, restaurants, breweries, markets, coffee shops, etc.
host_about:
Hi! I'm originally from Malaysia, but I've lived in Buenos Aires and Singapore before moving to Los Angeles for college. I currently live in Boston with my partner, who is studying at MIT. I have a remote job as an arts administrator, and counting my lucky stars to be able to work from anywhere with an internet connection!

Another side-effect of frequent moving: I get restless and I love to travel and explore new places.

Food, art, music, museums and great company are the highlights of my trips!

name: Economy 2 Bed w/ Free Parking in East Cambridge
description:
This is an economy 2 bed, 1 bath with a free parking space available in East Cambridge. This is close to many main destinations including MIT, Kendall Square, Cambridgeside Galleria, and the Charles River.

Unit is in a classic Cambridge home. So it does not have a recently renovated feel. But everything is clean and functional. The unit's best selling point is its central location and that we can provide free parking- a rarity in Cambridge.

The space
2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom. Please pay attention to the photos. There is no dedicated 'living room'.

Other things to note
Parking space is a few blocks away. Only space for one car, no particularly large cars, but a medium SUV or smaller should be fine.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Charming Multi-Level Townhouse, Harvard, MIT, MBTA
description:
Location, location, location, charming multi-level townhouse found minutes to Harvard Business School, Red line, and Central Square. Easy access to MIT, Longwood Medical hospitals,  universities, Harvard , Kendall and Inman Sq.

The space
Townhome is found on a quiet residential street featuring 4 levels of living  . This space can be used as a one bedroom with  two living rooms, 1.5 baths and basement or a two bedroom, living room, 1.5 baths and basement.

First floor features a kitchen, dining and living room, second floor bedroom offers  a queen sized bed and full bathroom. Trundle bed with a full and twin size mattress located on the third floor, 50" flat screen Tv and desk. (Please note: must walk thru second floor bedroom to access third floor.) Lower level features a half bath, desk and additional seating area.

On-site rental parking and coin-op laundry.

Guest access
Entire unit, coin-op laundry.
neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street. Much of Harvard University’s student housing is located in Riverside. Riverside is also home to some of Harvard’s academic facilities and the primary academic and administrative facility for Cambridge College
Riverside is a neighborhood in Cambridge, Massachusetts with a population of 12,181. Riverside is in Middlesex County and is one of the best places to live in Massachusetts. Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: 2 Bed w/ Free Parking in East Cambridge
description:
This is a very well located 2 bed apartment with nearby parking (a very rare amenity in the Cambridge/Boston area). You'll be close to MIT, Harvard, the Charles River, as well as several shopping areas and grocery stores that have everything you'd need during your stay.

This is a great place to stay for your trip to Cambridge or Boston area.

Other things to note
We have one parking space available about a 5 min walk away. This is great for short term guests because parking in the Cambridge/Boston area is a challenge for nonresidents. So an off street parking space for visitors is a rare amenity we're able to offer.

The rest of the neighborhood is very walkable with a walk score of 96. You'll be able to walk to all the stores you need on a day to day basis. There is a large grocery store and a Target just a few blocks away.
neighborhood_overview: Very nice, quiet, and safe neighborhood. Near many shops and stores for all your day to day needs. Within walking distance to parks, the river, MIT, and other major sites.

name: (31) Bright large room with skylight on top floor
description:
This sun-filled large room is situated on the top floor of our large Victorian-style house. It has three windows and a skylight with ample natural light and a view of our lovely ginkgo trees in the front. The room has one queen bed, and two twin beds for a perfect family stay up to four people, two adults and two children. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.

The space
Due to COVID-19 safety protocols, we are asking our guests to limit their uses of shared areas including the living room, dining room, and kitchen areas to one party at a time.

Guest access

Other things to note
PARKING: Please note that we have very limited parking spaces. If you will have a car duri
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

description:
Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.

The space
This is a deluxe king room, equipped with a king bed, wet bar with sink, microwave and fridge, as well as our basic amenity package - a smart TV for wireless streaming, fast and free wi-fi and local coffee/tea in-room. Guest access
In addition to the rooms, there are two great common spaces to enjoy. Inside, our Parlour + Sunroom Lounge is the perfect plac
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

name: Kendall Sq Studio w/ W/D, Gym & Concierge nr MIT
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this stylish studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Kendall Square home with stunning views over the city. (ID #BOS647)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this studio property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio include an on-site:

- BBQ Area
- Doorman
- Dryer
- Elevator
- Game room
- Gym
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. name: Healthy well-designed home, walk everywhere
description:
I was a Superhost before taking a break during covid and now back on-line hosting.....Convenient, safe, quiet, and healthy indoors. Shopes, restaurants, recreations, universities and more all within walking distance.

Please note that guests must be fully vaccinated and show a negative covid test within 24-hours of arrival.

The space
Enjoy this contemporary home. Eco-friendly, LEED platinum certified featuring 60 energy and water, efficiency, health, and environmental features...that I am always happy to explain if you are interested. Convenient to public transport. Grocery stores, shopping mall and smaller boutique shops nearby. Recreational facilities within easy walk to the cambridge Reservoir, Charles River, 60-acre Danehy Park, Minuteman Bikeway and more. Many restaurants at various prices and styles are within short walks. Exclusive use of private bedroom with queen bed with organic mattress, private bath. Share the lovely garden, kitchen
neighborhood_overview: Primarily residential neighborhood, easy access to shops, parks, museums
host_about:
Thanks for your interest in staying in my home. I was a Superhost on Airbnb for about 6 years before covid and have just re-opened for new reservations.  I have enjoyed living in a healthy, toxic-free and energy-efficient home that I designed/built as the first LEED Platinum home in Massachusetts in 2007. 

My home is about a mile from Harvard Square - easily walkable, bikeable, and only one block from a bus that would take you there directly. The Tufts campus is about 1-1/2 miles and easily walkable, as are Lesley University and MIT is a bit farther down the road. Personally, I was born and raised in Cambridge, though I have lived in several other countries and travelled extensively for work and pleasure to >50 countries.    

Professionally,  my company builds sustainable, affordable housing for low-income populations in developing countries. I have also been in/out of academia as a adjunct professor, executive at Harvard, and interim president at a small college.

name: Modern 2Br/2bt nr Subway Harvard Tufts 6mth lease
description:
Located conveniently on Mass Ave in Cambridge, this updated 2b/2b is short walk from Davis Sq through a lovely tree-line bike path. Find all you need in everyday life from restaurants to shops to banks. You can move-in and start your life immediately with ease. Hop on MBTA buses to Harvard right in front of the next building. Perfect for Academic year or longer term lease. Sip your drinks at courtyard sitting/dining area while surfing web or reading in the outdoor breeze or sunshine!

Other things to note
In building garage available at minimal 99/mth.
host_about:
I've been an Airbnb host for few years now and recently had a pleasure of being a guest so I know what people expect from a Host and a Guest. 
I truly enjoy hosting Airbnb and I think it's a great community of people, almost like a world web of great hosts and guests.
As for me I'm very sociable person and Airbnb gives me an opportunity to meet different people each time.
I also like to keep things clean and organized and spend most of my time reading books, doing research on a healthy lifestyle and of course trying to live one! :)
"A ship in the harbor is safe, but that's not what ships are built for."

Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Cambridge, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

- BBQ Area

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Charming apartment with parking
description:
Welcome to my newly renovated apartment located close to restaurants, a golf course, and Fresh Pond reservoir for runners. There are two bus lines that take you to Harvard Square in 10 mins.

The space
This private apartment is on the first floor of a two-family house. It features hardwood floors and a 9-foot ceiling throughout the 700-sqft space.

The first bedroom is at the back of the unit and comes with a queen bed. The other bedroom is equipped with a full bed. The living room is next to the kitchen with a granite countertop.

Neighborhood: Many good restaurants, parks, quiet at night

For a longer stay, the washer and dryer could come in handy and they are just in the kitchen pantry.

The driveway can accommodate one car. If you have visitors, there's usually easy on-street parking.

Guest access
This is the lower level of a two-family house. Guests are welcome to use the backyard.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Classic Cambridge House in the Heart of the City
description:
This is a classic old Cambridge house in the heart of the Boston.

In the greater Boston-area, Cambridge is king. Everything from good food, 7-days a week events, intellectual conferences, movies, poetry, nature trails, and historical areas can be found a walk away in Cambridge.

The house is over 100 years old: living history with beautiful lighting and lots of windows.

The space
Two bedrooms in the main floor with a big living room area that is connected with a full kitchen. On the lower floor there is a laundry unit with another room that serves as an office or extra room. There is a backyard where you may cook-out or enjoy the sun, watch and listen to the birds.

The house has two floors. You will be in the first floor, completely private, but other people live in the house so please be respectful. Backyard is shared with others in the house.

Guest access
The house has two floors. Guests have at their ful
neighborhood_overview:
Nice neighborhood, 7 min walk away from the Charles river where you can walk and enjoy the trails and bridges.

7 min walk to Central Square: connection to red line train station [connects to the airport and South Station]/ bus station/ groceries, bars, restaurants.

15 min walk to Harvard Square.

20 min to MIT.

description:
This quiet, peaceful, full-featured studio in Inman Square is a great choice for your next trip to Cambridge/Boston. It is centrally located—a 10 to 15 minute walk to Harvard, MIT, Central Square, and the tech companies around Kendall Square. Whole Foods, Koreana, S&S Deli, local microbreweries, and many more food options are within blocks. This self-contained studio with its kitchen, laundry, and en suite is an excellent place to “get away” and yet be in the heart of Cambridge.

The space
This self-contained studio is the third floor of an historic (1840's) home in mid-Cambridge. It has been designed with our guest's comfort in mind.

Guest access
Guests will have access to all the public areas--downstairs kitchen, outdoor deck, second floor sitting area, and second floor bathroom (shared with one other guest). This second floor bathroom is in addition to the en suite bathroom.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in Inman Square, halfway between Harvard and MIT. This location is special because it is on a street that only exists for two blocks and is shielded from the noise of surrounding streets. All the convenience with almost none of the commotion. Mid-Cambridge is a vibrant neighborhood with wonderful restaurants/food sources (e.g., S&S Deli, Koreana, Whole Foods)  and microbreweries within blocks. It is a very safe area with many long-time residents.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Walk to Harvard, MIT, Central, Subway, Book Now
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place.

Our lovely and spacious Victorian home is located on a quiet one-way street between Central and Inman Squares. A fifteen-minute walk will bring you to historic Harvard Square or MIT where the subway can transport you to downtown Boston in under 10 minutes on the red line.

Make our home your home away from home!

The space
The clean and comfortable room has a double bed with cotton sheets, desk, chair, closet/dresser, and lots of natural light.

Shared bathroom, large kitchen, dining room & lounge.

The space has high ceilings and beautiful wood floors throughout.

Guest access
Vibrant Inman Square & Central Square is a 10-minute walk with a large selection of fabulous restaurants & groceries for all budgets. Free on-street parking is available on Broadway off-street parking is available on request on a first come first serve basis.

PERFECT FOR VISITORS, SCHOLARS, PROFESSIONALS, AND ATHLETES, ETC:
Make the top 2 floors of our newly renovated house your perfect home-away-from-home while visiting, working, or training in Cambridge + the greater Boston area.

-Private entrance;

neighborhood_overview: Ideally located on a pretty tree-lined, family friendly, side street, in a quiet, residential neighborhood. Leave your car behind as it's totally safe, walkable, and ONLY: steps to the bus stop that goes direct to Harvard Square and Boston; or a quick 2-3 block walk to Davis Square Red Line Metro/ T stop. Walk or bike 1-5 blocks to 30+ restaurants, cafe's, shops, movie cinema, post office, drug store, grocery store, gym, ice-cream, bars, Minuteman bike/jog commuter trail (13+ miles shaded + paved), parks, tennis courts, pool, + public transportation, etc.
host_about: Our family’s background is in medicine, venture capital, academia, oceanography, high tech, dance, and music. As multi-cultural world travelers, educated at Yale, Harvard, Hasso Plattner Institute, Columbia, Grace Hopper, UCDavis, Alvin Ailey, La Scala, and/or the National Ballet of Guatemala, we seek out fun adventures, and spending time with special people. We also enjoy getting to know kind like-minded souls from all over the world and hosting them in our large, new-renovated home now that our 3 kids are launched.

name: Cambridgeport 1BR w/ W/D & Gym, nr Boston U & MIT
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this sophisticated one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Central Square home. (ID #BOS687)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom include an on-site:

- Dryer
- Elevator
- Gym
- Washing machine
- Parking
- Pets allowed
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: East Cambridge 2BR w/ W/D & Gym, nr Lechmere T
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this spacious East Cambridge furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and roomy living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS740)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this two-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom include an on-site:

- BBQ Area
- Doorman
- Dryer
- Elevator
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: Close to Everything! MIT/Harvard/Lesley/Porter Sq.
description:
Prime location with everything within walking distance or one quick subway ride.

3 mins walk to Porter Square (red line), which leads you to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), MGH (20 mins, door to door). 5 mins walk to Lesley University, supermarket, and many cafe/eateries. Spacious room with lots of natural light. Shared dine-in kitchen and bathroom (3 people max) gives you full convenience with enough privacy.

Nearby hotel (Porter Square Hotel) is asking $300/night!

The space
The house is on the second and third floor. Each floor has three bedrooms and one shared bathroom.

You will have a spacious room with a queen bed, a working desk, and a built-in closet. During your stay, you can also enjoy the access to the shared kitchen (fully-equip), shared bathroom (3 people max), and a cute shared porch where you can enjoy a book or a weekend brunch.

The room is on the third floor at the end of the hallway. This is the quiet
neighborhood_overview:
I've lived in Boston/Cambridge for over 10 years and I couldn't recommend this location more for those who seek convenience without breaking your wallet.

Porter Square, like all the other locations in Cambridge, offers high quality life, convenience to all the local cafes, eateries, supermarkets, and most importantly, safe neighborhood! (as a female, this is on my top priority list!)

If you are here for a semester exchange, research, or fellowships at MIT, Harvard or Lesley (even downtown at Suffolk or work trips), highly recommend this location for those who seek comfortable stay in a safe and vibrant neighborhood but with a bit tight budget.
host_about: I am a digital nomad, travel tech enthusiast, having lived in US, EU, and Asia. I manage my family's units as well as my home.

description: Vacant 2 bedroom + 2 bathroom apartment available for rent! The unit is EMPTY with BARE ESSENTIALS ONLY! Air mattress available upon request. Access to in-unit wifi, heating/AC system and washer + dryer.  Elevator in building.  Walking distance to Harvard Square (in Cambridge) and close to downtown Boston. Many good restaurants nearby! This could be great for someone moving to the Cambridge/Somerville area while looking for a longer term rental, or waiting for a September 1st lease to start.
host_about: I love traveling and enjoy being in the center of everything or getting off the beaten path! My ideal vacation  has some of both. My favorite thing to do when traveling is see the unique natural and/or historic sites. I love hiking/walking, swimming, boating, etc. and don't mind a little adventure to get to a good spot! I also love trying new foods and doing a little local shopping.  For me, traveling is one of the most energizing and worthwhile things I can do. I most often travel with my siblings (I have 5!) or with my boyfriend. Girls trips are always fun too. I do less travel for work, but when I do I like to at least sneak in some "local" fun - like checking out a site or going to a nice restaurant.

The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

Our newly renovated apartment is on the third floor of our beautiful 1884 victorian house. The unit has a deck, brand new kitchenette, bathroom, and laundry. It's centrally located between Harvard and Porter Squares - convenient for folks visiting Harvard or who want to hop on the subway to other parts of Cambridge or Boston.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a beautiful residential neighborhood between Harvard and Porter Squares - so it's easy to walk to Harvard or jump on the subway.  There are lots of cafes and restaurants nearby.
host_about: My husband and I have lived in our house since 1987!  I grew up in Cambridge  (since 1970) in the house next door.  We love our neighborhood because you can walk to anything and take the subway anywhere.  We have lots of delicious restaurants nearby and a lot to do (Harvard Sq., Harvard Art museums, etc).   We also have a wire-haired miniature dachshund named Harry.

name: Stylish House in Kendall/MIT near Boston w/ Garden
description:
Right at the heart of Kendall/MIT, minutes away from the Red line and Lechmere Green line, this modern, Scandinavian inspired home is the perfect place for your Boston/Cambridge stay. A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from Harvard Square to Newbury Street.

The space
The ground floor bedroom features a firm queen-sized bed and a closet. Adjacent, is a private bathroom with a spacious shower.

The house itself is newly renovated and carefully designed--full of Danish furniture, high end appliances, and beautiful art. The open design of the first floor allows for a welcoming living, dining, and kitchen space. The kitchen has a Sub-Zero fridge, Wolf stove and oven, and large marble countertops. It also opens out onto a deck with patio furniture. Here you can have your morning coffee whi
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

name: All yours: kitchen & bedroom!
description:
This great rental is half of a beautiful, classic Cambridge apartment. Your space consists of a sunny bedroom with double bed, private fully equipped eat-in kitchen, work nook, and huge outdoor covered deck. The bathroom is semi-private -- we use it a bit, but only you would use the bath/shower. (Note: there is no living room). There is a dog living upstairs who may be in the other half of the apartment (completely closed off), so it wouldn't work for those with dog allergies or fear of dogs.

The space
This apartment is the 2nd floor of a classic Cambridge "triple decker" (3 unit building). It's a lovely space, colorful, calm, and inviting. It would be great for a visiting academic or professional. There is a shared entry way through which the private guest spaces are accessed, as are the spaces that are used strictly by the hosts. The host spaces (a home office, guest room, and craft room) are separated from the guest spaces by doors, weather stripped to impr
neighborhood_overview: This is "neighborhood 9" in Cambridge. It is right between Porter Square and Huron Village. The apartment is a 12 minute walk to Porter Square where there is the "red line" subway that goes to Harvard, MIT, and Boston. There are also bus lines to various other localities. Porter Square and Huron village both have wonderful shops, restaurants, and bars, plus a grocery store, drugstore -- everything you need within walking distance.  The neighborhood has numerous parks (including tennis and basketball courts), a ton of public green space, various great running routes, and the bike share station is half a block away.
host_about: We are a family of four: a high school math teacher,  a transportation planner, a teen, a preteen, and a dog.
